pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:0.2: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:0.5: 13. The training rule on loud noises
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.2: At that time the monks from the group of six were noisy while walking in inhabited areas. …
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.3.1: “‘I will not be noisy while walking in inhabited areas,’ this is how you should train.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.4: One should not be noisy while walking in an inhabited area.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.5: If a monk, out of disrespect, makes loud noises while walking in an inhabited area, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.13: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk13:1.14: The third training rule is finished.
